intro: Monvillea phatnosperma subsp. adelmarii, commonly known as the Adelmarii monvillea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It features elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces fragrant, violet-colored flowers. Due to its restricted habitat and rarity, it is considered a conservation concern.
